alert.note: Alert for Cedar; Clinton; Jackson; Scott (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 3:10AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Whiteside, southeastern Carroll, northeastern Rock Island, northwestern Bureau, north central Henry, Scott, Clinton, southwestern Jackson and southeastern Cedar Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 310 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Toronto to Albany to Coleta. Movement was south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Camanche, Albany and Low Moor around 315 AM CDT. Wheatland and Calamus around 320 AM CDT. Princeton and Cordova around 325 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Port Byron, Le Claire, Hampton, Rapids City, Lyndon, Prophetstown, Tampico and Osborn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 74 in Iowa between mile markers 1 and 2. Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 280 and 306. Interstate 80 in Illinois between mile markers 1 and 4. Interstate 88 between mile markers 1 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
